fields.description:
*Background:*
On JIRA start, the IndexRecoveryLauncher checks that the index is up to date with the database and attempts to catch it up if it detects that it has fallen behind. If the index is in a corrupt state however this leaves JIRA locked.

*Expected behaviour:*
The expected behavior is that JIRA is allowed to start to give an admin an opportunity of recovering the index from a known good snapshot. Search related functionality will not be usable until the corruption issue is fixed.

*Workaround:*
The workaround is to move the corrupt index directory out of the way before starting JIRA. Once JIRA has started the index can be restored from a backup or the index can be rebuilt with a reindex operation. The corrupt files can then be removed.

*Diagnosis:*
Instances affected by this issue will be inaccessible and a stacktrace similar to the following will be logged:
{code}
2015-04-12 19:21:06,249 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener] Unable to start JIRA.
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearchUnavailableException: com.atlassian.jira.util.RuntimeIOException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /opt/j2ee/domains/atlassian.com/extranet-jira/jira-home/caches/indexes/issues/_3yfh2_4.de
l (No such file or directory)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.retrieveEntitySearcher(SearcherCache.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueSearcherFactory.getEntitySearcher(DefaultIssueSearcherFactory.java:29)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchProviderFactoryImpl.getSearcher(SearchProviderFactoryImpl.java:29)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:419)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:413)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.searchOverrideSecurity(LuceneSearchProvider.java:117)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.getLatestIndexDate(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:302)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.getDurationToRecover(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:282)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.IndexRecoveryLauncher.start(IndexRecoveryLauncher.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher$3.run(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:143)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrEnqueue(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:345)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrWhenDatabaseActivated(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:215)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDbLaunch(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:124)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.access$100(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:33)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher$1.run(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:86)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.devspeed.JiraDevSpeedTimer.run(JiraDevSpeedTimer.java:34)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.start(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:81)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.contextInitialized(LauncherContextListener.java:72)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4939)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.startInternal(StandardContext.java:5434)
        at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:150)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.addChildInternal(ContainerBase.java:901)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.addChild(ContainerBase.java:877)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHost.addChild(StandardHost.java:633)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig.deployDescriptor(HostConfig.java:663)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig$DeployDescriptor.run(HostConfig.java:1642)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)

fields.description:
It seems the Gravatar support is not working well in JIRA 6.4. See [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+a+User+Avatar?focusedCommentId=728139293#comment-728139293]:

{quote}
Just installed 6.4.1 which is supposed to support gravatars at the same time as custom and built-in avatars. It kinda does, but so far it is behaving weirdly. The documentation on this page says your gravatar should appear as one of the choices the dialogue; it does but it appears many times in all the spots where you had custom images. It still displays the custom image, not the gravatar. On the other hand, if you choose a built-in avatar the your gravatar is displayed.
So the actual functionality appears to be if you have gravatars enabled and you have a gravatar, that appears to override any built-in avatar but not custom images. When a gravatar override is in effect, you'll see a 'GRAVATAR' icon underneath your image in the profile editor.
That functionality is ok, except that the person implementing that apparently wasn't following the same blueprint as the people implementing the avartar editing dialog and documentation (smile)
It this how it is working for other 6.4.1 users?
{quote}
fields.summary: Gravatar overrides all JIRA built-in avatars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42854].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA allows Administrators to choose if Gravatar is enabled, which means that an user can either use gravatar or a custom picture in JIRA. As a JIRA Administrator, I would like to force users to only use their gravatar pictures.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to use *only* gravatar, along with the existing options to use only JIRA's or both gravatar and JIRA's.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I would like to choose whether users should use Gravatar, JIRA avatars or both.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42853].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Prior to JIRA 6.3, enabling users to use Gravatars in their user profile instead of JIRA-specific avatars caused users not to be able to use JIRA-specific avatars (and vice versa). However, from 6.3 onwards as part of JRA-33596 it is now able to use both together.

However, according to our [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options] documentation:
bq. Enables users to use Gravatars in their user profile instead of JIRA-specific avatars. Users will not be able to use JIRA-specific avatars if Gravatars are enabled, and vice versa. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Edit the above to match what is displayed in JIRA - something like:
bq. Allows loading external avatars from a Gravatar server
fields.summary: Update Configuring JIRA Options documentation regarding Gravatars

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Usually when a page times-out, the input on the screen will be either saved in the browser. There is no warning that the operation will fail which will clear all data on it.

h4. Environment
Version 6.2 - Mac OS X, Firefox 37.0.1, Chrome 41.0.2272 (64-bit) 


h4. _*Steps to Reproduce*_

1. Raise a support request from within your local jira instance.  *Administration -> System -> Atlassian Support Tools -> Open "Support Request" Tab*:
2. Write your description and wait for about 10 minutes and try to send it. 
3. The form will be cleared with a admin reconnect Error and nothing is sent.

h4. Expected Results
Input on the screen will be either saved in the browser field after the operation refreshes the page or warns users that operation will fail before refreshing the page content.

h4. Actual Results
Input in fields are lost when Page refresh/ operation are not completed without warning.

h4. Notes.
fields.summary: Web-sudo times out while user enters details into fields.  Field entry is then lost without warning.

fields.description:
Creating a user directory with type "Internal with LDAP Authentication" will create implicit LDAP filters depending on the actual directory type (e.g. OpenLDAP (Posix)). The user has no chance to change these default filters, as changing directory type (e.g. to OpenLDAP) will not adapt the filters. 

Note that this is different from [JRA-24229|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24229] as there the "LDAP" directory type is affected that allows the admin to set filters and the like on his own.
fields.summary: Directory "Internal with LDAP Authentication" creates implicit unchangeable filters.

fields.description:
When a user sets the limit of issues to view or a group that can export unlimited issues as stated in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Export+More+Than+1000+Results+to+Excel], JIRA fails to recognize this settings.

Adding the following to jira-config.properties should make the following changes:
{code}
jira.search.views.default.max // this is the max that will always show up by default when a user clicks export
jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group // the group that can export an unlimited amount of issues in excel (the group cannot have a space in it due to this bug: 
jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count=-1//Should allow exporting unlimited amount of issues.
{code}

h5. Expected Results:
- this is the max that will always show up by default when a user clicks export
- the group that can export an unlimited amount of issues in excel (the group cannot have a space in it due to this bug:

h5. Actual results.
- The limit you can view in JIRA is still 1000 (JIRA then asks you to refine search as there are too many issues)
-* Fix: Configure the limit directly from {{Admin > General Configuration > Advanced Setting}}.
-* jira.search.stable.max.results to the limit you want.
- The limit users can export when the set the {{jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group}} is not respected with JIRA still exporting the maximum limit allowed by {{jira.search.views.max.limit}} as set in the jira-config.properties.
Lastly, if any of these values is set to "-1" which should allow unlimited search results and exports, JIRA simply ignores it.

Note that even if added via database, the {{jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group}} setting does not show up in the UI Advanced Settings.
Thanks.

fields.description:
h4. Problem Description
We are seeing some bugs related to scroll functionalities on Wallboards plugin.
* On Chrome a scroll bar appears when the content is greater than the screen size (vertical). However, this bar seems to be useless, since it won't scroll up or down properly (see attached screenshot).
* On IE11 the scroll bar was not visible and we weren't able to scroll up or down through the wallboard.
* On Firefox 37.0.1 the scroll bar was not visible as well, however we have been able to scroll through the wallboard upon using mouse mid-click.

h4. Enrivonment used on tests
JIRA 6.4
Wallboard Plugin 1.9.5

h4. Browsers tested:
Chrome 41.0.2272.118
Firefox 37.0.1
IE 11.0.9600.17691
fields.summary: Scrolling issues on JIRA Wallboards plugin

fields.description:
During issue creation, with the IssueService, and an IssueInputParameters bean, setting _iip.setApplyDefaultValuesWhenParameterNotProvided(true)_  results in the Resolution Date being set to the same date as the Creation Date.  Given that the workflow of the issue is Unresolved, I think that this should not happen:

{noformat}
Created:	Just now
Updated:	Just now
Resolved:	Just now
{noformat}

The only scenario I can see that this flag would be usable is during an issue workflow transition to resolve.  But its odd that no reference or check is made for such.

Without _setApplyDefaultValuesWhenParameterNotProvided(true)_ issues do not inherit expected default values from Custom Field definitions.  Addons would need to query every single custom field, to establish if it has a default value, then set it via IIP.  If this is not a bug, what then is the purpose of that method?
fields.summary: IssueService IssueInputParameters setApplyDefaultValuesWhenParameterNotProvided

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42821].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When creating an issue, if we switch the fields being shown via the 'Configure Fields' button (for example switching from 'All' to 'Custom' and vice-versa), the value of custom fields would be cleared out

h3. Environment
* Tested in JIRA 6.3.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field (for the sake of testing, we will use a multi-line text field)
# Make sure that it is in the screen when creating an issue, and insert a value into the field (don't create the issue yet though)
# Use the 'Configure Fields' button to switch over from 'All' to 'Custom' (ensure that the field is showing in 'Custom' as well)

h3. Expected Results

The value of the field should still be present even though the tab is switched.

h3. Actual Results
The values of the field does not appear

!configurefield1.png|thumbnail! 

!configurefield2.png|thumbnail,!

h3. Notes
* This does not occur when editing an already created issue
* Have also tested this in Select List custom field, same problem occurs

h3.Solution / Workaround

This seems to have been fixed in JIRA 6.4, as it no longer occurs in that version
fields.summary: Switching the fields tab via the 'Configure Fields' button clears out custom field values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42819].
  {panel}

When a user searches for issues where a particular user is added to customfield of type participant using the following JQL:
{code}
"Special Participants" = "username"
{code}
No results are returned.

Steps to replicate:

* Install JIRA Toolkit plugin
* Add custom field "Participants" of type "Participants of an issue" (I think this happens automatically)
* Add the custom field to the Default screen in JIRA (might happen automatically by installing plugin).
* View an issue
* Click on the name of a participant, assume name = john.
* Observe that it takes you to the issue search, but only showing the most recent search you have perforfmed.
* Expected behaviour: Show all issues user "john" has participated in.

Thanks.
fields.summary: JQL Search with customfield of type Participant returns no result

h3.Description

Special character like double quotes and "@" breaks attachment linking.

h3.Steps to Reproduce

* Create a file named *"test@atlassian.com" for you.txt* .
* Attached the file to a JIRA ticket.
* Try linking the attached file to a comment.

h3.Expected Result

The file is properly linked to the comment.

h3.Result

[^"test@atlassian.com" for you.txt] doesn't link the file but instead appear exactly as it is.

fields.description:
Deleting a project which has a lot of versions is extremely slow. Additionally, the UI does not really show that its actually working on the delete, but rather it just spins infinitely UNTIL the delete completes.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create the following Bash script to generate 2000 versions on a JIRA project using REST:{noformat}
#!/bin/bash

for i in {1..2000}
do
   curl -D- -u username:password -X POST --data "{\"description\": \"Version\",\"name\": \"$i\",\"archived\": \"false\",\"released\": \"false\",\"releaseDate\": \"2010-07-06\",\"project\": \"PROT\",\"projectId\": \"10000\"}" -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://your-jira-url/rest/api/2/version
done
{noformat}
# Note that this project *does not have any issues*, just 2000 versions.
# Delete the project.
# Observe that the page just spins infinitely, but actually the delete is happening. 
# Checking the database, we can see the number of versions associated to the project is decreasing. The lesser the number of versions, the faster the deletion progresses. 

In total, it took about *2 hours* to delete an empty project with *2000* versions on it. 

Suggestions:
# Either show a progress page that the deletion is in progress, or
# Improve the delete algorithm. It shouldn't take so long to delete versions that are not used in any issues.
fields.summary: Deleting a project with a lot of versions is very slow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42812].
  {panel}

When working with large projects and hundreds to thousands of users it's not uncommon for users to see errors in issues that moderators miss. Currently the best they can do to help is to comment on an issue. To better facilitate this JIRA should add a moderation queue.

Users would be given the full moderator toolkit and the ability to make any change they want. The only catch is their requests would be added to a moderation queue. So a user could decide to change the title, link an issue to a duplicate, or close an issue and these would show up as chronological requests in the moderation queue.

A moderator would then be able to view pending requests and approve or deny them and visually see what's being change from the old value to the new value. This would allow many rapid changes to be made with the help of a large community. Moderators could also remove all the requests from a specific user from the queue.

Another useful feature would be to connect the number of approved moderations to specific users. This might help communities in picking out future moderators for community driven issue trackers and to reward users that are helping.
fields.summary: Add a moderation queue that regular users can add requests to and that moderators can approve or deny

  {panel}

h4. Summary
When an existing JIRA user send an email to create issue, even though the *Default Reporter* has been set, the issue will not be created.

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.3.15
Gmail email account

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new JIRA Mail Handler to Project A, set Default reporter to *admin*
# Create new Permission Scheme, and limit *Create Issue* and *Add Comments* to jira-administrators group
# Create *UserA* as a normal user
# Have *UserA* send an email to create issue in JIRA

h4. Expected Results
Issue will be created and *admin* will be the reporter

h4. Actual Results
Email will be ignored and issue is not created in JIRA
!ignoredmail.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
[~libor.tvrdik1] came up with this patch: [^jira-mail-plugin.patch]. Can we look into this [~ohernandez@atlassian.com]?
fields.summary: Unable to create issue from email when the Reporter does not have permission to create an issue

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 6 September 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Attaching issues on the workflow transition screen is not now supported, as of JIRA 7.2.1.
 The feature request to support the feature is tracked under JRA-42900.

Since we do not support file upload on the workflow transition - I'm closing this issue as not a bug now. Please vote for the mentioned feature request issues as we prfioritize our feature backlog by the number of votes.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have further question regarding this issue.
 Thank you.

Cheers,
 Ignat
 JIRA Server Bugmaster.
{panel}
h4.  
h4. Summary

Attaching files in transition screen (on Filter Result gadget) failed with Internal Error message
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Refer to any issues retrieved in Filter Result gadget (on the dashboard)
 # Click on the arrow > choose any transition
 # Try attaching any file

h4. Expected result

The attachment file should be uploaded successfully
h4. Actual Result

The attachment is not uploaded successfully and it throws error message "Internal Error"
 !attach.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attaching files in transition screen (on Filter Result gadget) failed with Internal Error message

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42797].
  {panel}

*Problem Description*

Generating the backup from the latest release for JIRA Server (6.4.1) encounter the following error when importing to JIRA Cloud:

{quote}
The xml data you are trying to import is from JIRA 6.4.1, which is newer than your current version of JIRA and will not work. This data can be successfully imported into JIRA 6.3.12 or later., If JIRA 6.3.12 is not yet available for download, please contact support.
{quote}

*Expected Result*

Latest release of the JIRA Server should be supported to perform import to the JIRA Cloud instance. It is always recommended to use latest release to migrate or perform merging for the Cloud instances.

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+from+JIRA+Cloud+to+JIRA+Server

*Workaround*

Use JIRA Server version 6.3.12 from the link below:

* https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-archives

Perform a restore using the backup XML and generate a new backup XML
fields.summary: Importing JIRA Server 6.4.1 to JIRA Cloud fails Due to JIRA Server having higher Version Number

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42794].
  {panel}

As a user of a federated JIRA installation I would like to have automatic JIRA issue linking in comments regardless of which instance the JIRA issue resides on so that I have full visibility of communications regarding issues in my JIRA site.

Currently in JIRA when I enter the Issue key for a JIRA issue into the comments of any issue JIRA will automatically create a hyperlink to the mentioned issue.  This also creates a backling from the issue to the comment.  In a federated installation JIRA will behave this way only for issues that are local to the JIRA instance.  For issues that are on a remote instance automatic hyperlinking does not work.

A rationale solution would be to add this as a native feature of the federated installation.  So that sites running configurations that are similar to the link below will have full access to the automatic linking featuer.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ENTERPRISE/Federating+JIRA+-+Managing+Multiple+Instances
fields.summary: In comment linking of JIRA issues on remote instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42793].
  {panel}

Currently, when you access a dashboard other than the system dashboard and you don't have any favourites, this message displays:

'The dashboard that you are viewing will only be displayed temporarily, as you do not have it added as a favorite. To display this dashboard permanently, add it as a favorite.'

"add it as a favorite" currently adds the dashboard for you, but it doesn't educate the user on what they need to do, or how to do it. This should be changed to something more helpful like:

'This dashboard is not available in your Dashboard menu.
To add it to the Dashboard menu, you need to add it as a favorite on the Manage Dashboards page.'

"Manage Dashboards" should link to the Manage Dashboards page.
fields.summary: Change the message on your dashboards when you do not have any favorites to something more useful.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42792].
  {panel}

When you have dashboards created but you have not added them to your favourites, you are presented with the system default dashboard, and a warning message that states:

'You are viewing the 'System Default' dashboard, as you have not added any dashboards as favorites. To display your preferred dashboard here, click Manage Dashboard and add one or more dashboards as favorites.'

This could be worded better to provide more context and information. Suggest changing it to:

'You can access other dashboards, but they're not currently displayed in the Dashboards menu.
To display them in the Dashboards menu, add them as favorites in the Manage Dashboards page.'

"Manage Dashboards" should link to the Manage Dashboards page.
fields.summary: Change the information message on the System Dashboard page to something that makes more sense.

fields.description:
When using the wiki markup editor in JIRA it's possible to accidentally lose any changes you've made to the content. In my case, it meant losing a few hundred words that I'd written up for an issue and then went back to apply formatting.

h1. Steps to reproduce.

# Begin editing the description of an issue.
# Make some changes (e.g. add some text) but don't commit the changes yet.
# Click the "Style" button, to reveal the different paragraph styles !screenshot-1.png!.
# Press ESC to dismiss the popup.

Doing this will dismiss the popup _and_ the editor. This means you will lose your changes. This is incredibly annoying when it happens.
fields.summary: Pressing ESC on description wikimarkup editor dropdown discards changes.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42780].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In JIRA, according to the [Atlassian Design Guidelines|https://design.atlassian.com/2.1/product/patterns/date-formats/] relative dates are shown such as "Yesterday". The absolute date and time can be shown using a tooltip.

Earlier versions of JIRA presented the relative date as "Yesterday 5:00pm", which helped JIRA users determine _when_ yesterday the date is making reference to, which is useful when dealing with young dates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue in JIRA (version 6.3+)
# Wait a day.
# Observe the Created date is in-line with the Atlassian Design Guidelines
# Observe that there is no option to show the time without hovering over the date.

h3. Expected Results
A method to show the relative date with a time.

h3. Actual Results
No option to show the relative date with the time.

h3. Notes
This is not a bug, but a feature request. The documentation [Customizing the Look and Feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customizing+the+Look+and+Feel#CustomizingtheLookandFeel-Date/TimeFormats] provides details about Time Formats in JIRA.

h3. Workarounds
# Using the tooltip, users can see the absolute value of a JIRA date.
# Following the steps in: [Disable Relative Dates in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Disable+Relative+Dates+in+JIRA]
fields.summary: Display Relative Dates with Time in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42779].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The JIRA documentation does not mention Deleting issues. This is causing some confusion for users who would like to know:
- What happens when an issue is *Deleted*
- What precautions should be taken.

h3. Expected Results
A page under [Working with an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Working+with+an+Issue] should document how to delete an issue, and the effect this has.

h3. Actual Results
No page for deleting an issue can be found.

h3. Notes 
As per the screenshot JIRA presents some guidance when a user trys to delete an issue:

{quote}
Please confirm that you wish to delete this issue.

Deleting an issue removes it permanently from JIRA, including all of its comments and attachments.

If you have completed the issue, it should usually be resolved or closed - not deleted.
{quote}

However this is not documented.
fields.summary: Documentation on Deleting Issues in JIRA

fields.description:
h5. Problem
The attachments are broken after the issues being moved to a project (whose Project Key has been changed previously).

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 projects (lets say project *ADAM* and project *WYNC*).
# Change project key of project *WYNC* to *WYNCX*.
# Create issue in project *ADAM* > upload some attachments (Lets say issue *ADAM2*).
# Move issue *ADAM2* to project *WYNCX* (previously known as *WYNC*).

h5. Expected result:
Refer to issue *ADAM2*, try to load attachments. Attachments should be loaded.

h5. Result
# Refer to issue *ADAM2*, try to load attachments. Attachments are broken
!after.png|thumbnail!
!notfound.png|thumbnail!
# From the database, we can see that pkey has been changed to *WYNCX* and originalkey is still *WYNC*.
!dbvanilla.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attachments are broken in the moved issues, due to project key changes

h3. Summary

When attempting to add a Japanese URL to a 'URL Field' Custom Field, it fails with the error "Not a valid URL".

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a 'URL Field' Custom Field.
# Add a multi-byte URL to it, for example http://日本語ドメイン名協会.jp/

h3. Expected Results

The URL is saved in the Custom Field.

h3. Actual Results

The error 'Not a valid URL' is entered.

h3. Workaround

# Enter the URL in to a browser, and it will convert it to a different URL such as http://xn--eckwd4c7cz44rqkf8kb898fdocu19k.jp/
# Save that in the Custom Field.
fields.summary: URL field does not accept URL with multi-byte characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42769].
  {panel}

Hi, is there a way to quickly and easily see a timesheet for my own user for today?

I want to be able to see what Hours I've logged for today.

That way, if it's the end of the day I can check to see if I forgot to log any hours on anything.

Or, more importantly, I can see WHEN the last time I logged hours was. Sometimes I will work on Task B without knowing what time I started Task B. I only know that I started Task B immediately after I logged hours for Task A. But I don't know when I logged hours for Task A. There are a couple ways to find out, but they are all really tedious. I could go to my profile and look through my activity stream, I could try to remember which ticket Task A was and look at its Work Log, I could try to use the Reports page but they are a hassle.
fields.summary: Quickly see my own timesheet (work log) for today?

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot add watchers via the count icon in some situations.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Situation #1
# Edit a field through 'inline editing';
(i) Some fields *will not* cause the behavior (eg. Summary, Priority)
# Click on the Watchers' count icon to add a new watcher;
# Frame will not be displayed

h4. Situation #2
# Search for issues using the "Issue Navigator"
# Set visualization to "Detail View"
# Click on the Watchers' count icon to add a new watcher;
# Frame will not be displayed

h4. Situation #3
# Search for issues using the Service Desk Agent's Queue
# Select any issue in the queue
# Click on the Watchers' count icon to add a new watcher;
# Frame will not be displayed


h3. Expected Results
JIRA Should display the "Add Watchers" frame below the Watchers icon

h3. Actual Results
No frame is displayed

h3. Workaround
Situation #1
Simply refreshing the page gets the feature working back again.

Situation #2
Open the issue on a separate tab/window (outside the "Issue Navigator") or use the More > Watchers link.

Situation #3
Open the issue on a separate tab/window to open the View Issue screen or use the More > Watchers link.
fields.summary: "Watchers" frame sometimes not displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42763].
  {panel}

Quite often when troubleshooting, the JIRA logs can be inundated with errors to the point where its not possible to distinguish events. Additionally, repeating errors have the side effect of making the logs roll, which means we can't go back a day or so. In those cases we typically do a "wait and see" while we keep our ear to the ground. 

Suggested log structure for JIRA Cloud to help alleviate said conditions above: 

*JIRA logging:*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/jira

*Mail logging:*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/mail

_Add-On logging (would be specific to customer):_

*Service Desk:*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/servicedesk

*JIRA Agile:*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/agile

*Tempo*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/tempo

Etc.
fields.summary: Parse JIRA logs into subfolders

h3.Summary

Undo is not working correctly in the description field. 

h3.Steps to replicate

* Type a sentence in the summary field. Copy this sentence.
* Enter twice to register 2 line breaks.
* Paste the sentence copied earlier. Undo the changes with Ctrl+z.

h3.Expected Result

The undo should undo the changes line by line. It will undo the the paste; the 2nd line break; the first line break and then focus the cursor at the end of the first sentence.

h3.Result

The undo removes all changes; removing both the line breaks and focusing the cursor back at the end of the first sentence.
fields.summary: Undo not working properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42751].
  {panel}

I have read through this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Cloning%20an%20Issue?continue=https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Cloning%20an%20Issue?src=search 

I would like to suggest that the same option which exists for Reporter (that it will list me as the reporter when I clone an issue) to also be setup for the Assignee.

As an example we have users call our Helpdesk and if they have the same or even a similar issue I would like to be able to clone it (thus saving me lots of time trying to fill out the work order request (/trouble ticket)) and just readjust the Summary and Description without anyone else needing to be notified via email that I had made a clone of the previously closed/completed work order (unless the admin must see it) just because they had helped this person in the past and was listed as the Assignee.
Since I am taking the call I would expect that I would be the Reporter and that I would also be the Assignee.

Another example is I have a work order with 4 sub-tasks for when we have a newly hired student worker. These sub-tasks go out to their respective areas requesting activation of an account or access to a network folder etc. Now the student is graduating and will no longer be working for us. I would like to open up that initial work order which says, "please grant access to. . . " Clone it and all the sub-tasks and have all of them assigned to me as Reporter and Assignee. Then all the information is there for the name of the student, their account, the access they needed, etc. Next I change the wording from "please grant access to. . . "  to  "remove access from . .  " on each of the work orders. Then assign it from me to the other individual/area for completion.

Right now if I clone the work order in the example above an email is generated to all the individuals in the sub-tasks and the wording in the Summary for those sub-tasks says that it is a Clone - . I have no opportunity to change anything in the sub-tasks just the main work order. Then any changes I make to the work order will send them an email, unless I change the assignee from them to me. Then on each of the sub-tasks I remove the "Clone-" from the Summary, remove/add labels and change the verbiage to "remove access from" in the description and then change the assignee back to that person.

If I automatically became the Reporter and the Assignee then all the emails for any change I make are not needed until the Work Order and sub-tasks are ready to be seen.

Here's for Hoping the Assignee can also have the option to be like the Reporter and be automatically given to the person Cloning the Work Order.  Thanks for listening.
Kris
fields.summary: Update or Extra Option to the way Cloning is Handled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *ReindexRequest* entity introduced in JIRA 6.3.8 originally contained a _query_ column that is no longer included, but no upgrade task has been defined to remove the column from the table in the database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA 6.3.8, using a database such as PostgreSQL.
# Upgrade it to 6.3.13 or higher.
# Start JIRA and watch the logs.

(i) The ReindexRequest entity was introduced in JIRA 6.3.8, and then modified in JIRA 6.3.13 to remove the _query_ field.  Therefore, this problem will only affect JIRA installations that were upgraded to one of JIRA 6.3.8 - 6.3.12, and then upgraded again to JIRA 6.3.13 or higher.  In our case, we upgraded to JIRA 6.3.9 and then 6.3.15.

h3. Expected Results

There are no warnings on startup, as the column no longer exists as it was removed in an upgrade task.

h3. Actual Results

As a result, when we start our instance, we see the following warnings in our log:

{noformat}
2015-04-01 10:34:13,819 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Column "QUERY" of table "public.reindex_request" of entity "ReindexRequest" exists in the database but has no corresponding field
2015-04-01 10:34:13,821 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Entity "ReindexRequest" has 7 fields but table "public.reindex_request" has 8 columns.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

# Create an XML backup of the instance.
# Restore that backup onto the instance.

This will overwrite the existing database with the new one, and recreate the schema from scratch. Either that or drop the {{query}} column from the table (not recommended as it's not known what other problems this could cause).

h3. Notes

Here are the relevant snippets from {{jira-project/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/ofbiz/entitydefs/entitymodel.xml}} to show the difference:

{code:language=xml|title=entitymodel.xml - JIRA 6.3.8}
    <entity entity-name="ReindexRequest" table-name="reindex_request" package-name="">
        <field name="id" type="numeric"/>

        <field name="type" type="short-varchar"/>
        <field name="query" type="very-long"/>
        <field name="requestTime" type="date-time"/>
        <field name="startTime" type="date-time"/>
        <field name="completionTime" type="date-time"/>
        <field name="status" type="short-varchar"/>

        <prim-key field="id" />
    </entity>
{code}

{code:language=xml|title=entitymodel.xml - JIRA 6.3.13}
    <entity entity-name="ReindexRequest" table-name="reindex_request" package-name="">
        <field name="id" type="numeric"/>

        <field name="type" type="short-varchar"/>
        <field name="requestTime" type="date-time"/>
        <field name="startTime" type="date-time"/>
        <field name="completionTime" type="date-time"/>
        <field name="status" type="short-varchar"/>
        <field name="executionNodeId" type="short-varchar" />

        <prim-key field="id" />
    </entity>
{code}
fields.summary: Database table reindex_request includes a column that is not included in the ReindexRequest entity

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to watch an issue in the Activity Stream, an error pops up in the UI. It is only triggered when the instance has a context path. 

h3. Environment
* Tested in JIRA 6.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a vanilla instance of 6.4.1 (with a context path)
# Create a project and issues so that the activity stream is filled up (a sample project works fine here)
# Try to watch any one of the issues in the activity stream. An error will occur

h3. Expected Results

The user is successfully added to the list of watchers of the issue

h3. Actual Results
The following error will show up in the UI :

!activitystream.png|thumbnail!

In the browser developer tool, it would show this :

!activitystream2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* The user is an admin that is a member of all groups
* Couldn't find much from the logs
* The issue can be watched if done so from the issue itself

h3. Workaround

The problem does not occur if no context path is configured on the instance (the base URL must reflect this as well).
fields.summary: Watching or voting an issue in the Activity Stream results in an error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42743].
  {panel}

Let's assume this use case scenario

# Create an issue with Original Estimate of 5h
# Log work of 1h, and the Remaining Estimate will automatically be calculated to be 4h
# Edit the issue and change the Original Estimate to 8h
# Leave Remaining Estimate value as is and proceed with Edit

You will see that Original Estimate is changed to 8h, Time Spent still maintains at 1h, but Remaining Estimate also maintains at 4h (doesn't auto recalculate to 7h)

As a manager, it is tedious to have to manually count the Remaining Estimate every time we want to update the Original Estimate. We would preferably just edit the Original Estimate, such that the Remaining Estimate will be automatically calculated.
fields.summary: Automatically calculate Remaining Estimate based on Original Estimate and Time Spent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42742].
  {panel}

It looks like that catalina.pid is not removed during linux shutdown process.
Tomcat is killed by SIGTERM rather than stop-jira.sh.

Tomcat startup abort if same PID of catalina.pid exist after restart linux.

*Environment*
* RHEL/CentOS Linux
* JIRA Linux Installer
* Service enabled

*Suggestion*
* adding some codes to /etc/rc.d/init.d/jira script
** chkconfig 345 85 15
** touch /var/lock/subsys/jira after start
** remove this lock file after stop

*Workaround*
* run stop-jira.sh before shutdown linux system
fields.summary: graceful service stop during linux shutdown process

fields.description:
The send() function in java/com/atlassian/jira/mail/MentionMailQueueItem.java always renders the comment using the atlassian/confluence wiki syntax:

 String content = rendererManager.getRenderedContent(
                AtlassianWikiRenderer.RENDERER_TYPE, comment, issueRenderContext);

It should honour the configured renderer for the comment field.  I realise that the mention behaviour working at all is dependent on mentions using the confluence syntax ([~user]), but it is confusing that when mention notifications are sent they're rendered differently to everything else.  See the attached image, for example, where the triple curly bracket syntax would cause the text contained in the block to be rendered differently if the correct renderer was used.
fields.summary: JIRA mention notifications don't use configured renderer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42731].
  {panel}

I've had to change a few workflow schemes recently and find it to be very annoying. Here's the problem: 

!screenshot-1.png|width=50%|height=50%!


The switch scheme screen show every issue type and every status that's changed in that issue type. Some of the issue types have 0 issues of that type. 








The status of an open "Operations" issue type has 0 affect on how the project is going to be affected as there are NO issues of that type. 

Proposed new feature; Only show issue types that have > 0 issue count. 

This way, the clutter doesn't affect me when I am mapping the issue. (If I get annoyed with all these 0's I have almost missed a non-0 issue type).
fields.summary: Hide issue types with 0 issues on switch workflow scheme screen

Update documentation "Connecting JIRA to PostgreSQL" to add database driver

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42721].
  {panel}

When a JIRA instance is configured, the user going through the installation wizard is forced to go over 12 steps showing how to use JIRA.

This can be a hassle for users that are already familiar with JIRA and are just setting up new instances. 

Adding a Skip button would reduce friction.

For users logging in for the first time, it's possible to disable this by following the steps of [How to Disable User Onboarding in JIRA 6.4|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Disable+User+Onboarding+in+JIRA+6.4]
fields.summary: Add Skip option to JIRA Onboarding
